text: hi I'm Sandra van dowski and I am
singing my very first Tosca at the
Metropolitan Opera there's so much
tradition that is really steeped in this
role that you have to respect a lot of
that and every great diva has some role
and Maria Callas has always been really
my idol because she wasn't afraid to
make an ugly noise when it called for it
and in act two especially of Tosca you
have to make some ugly noises you're
screaming your head off and you're
yelling at him preparing for Tosca is
always a treat because you know that
it's going to be a very physical evening
and also it's a very emotional evening
for the soprano because you can't just
walk in the park and sing Tosca you have
to be committed physically emotionally
and vocally to the role
while singing visitarte a it's it's
really one of my favorite areas because
of what it says I lived for art I live
for love I'm screaming screaming
screaming and then to stop and sing this
beautiful prayer it's hard for me when
I'm singing it not to cry I tell you
have a very good feeling was a because
she has a very good way to not to over
she doesn't go over she's very open to
understand the same and not to overact
and nothing and also but really act
really understand me so I think she's
okay I always say that what I want to do
is just transport people for a few hours
while there are here at the Opera House
I just want them to forget about their
own lives and just be transported and go
on the journey with all of us on stage
and hopefully I move them and have them
feel emotions along with me
